title: Web Browsers: How do I get the content of a URL bar when a net error occurs? - Quora

response.answer_text: Well, "How do I get the content of a URL bar when a net error occurs?" in the question detial I writed, it means how to get the URL( such as https://twitter.com) in the URL bar(omnibox), soved this, and then to think how to get the page content (such as use flow code as bookmarklet:javascript:var crurl;if(window.location.href=='data:text/html,chromewebdata') { crurl=document.title.match(/([^ ]*)/).pop();}else{crurl= document.location.href;};window.open('https://via.hypothes.is/'+crurl);) , Via http://stackoverflow.com/questions/29994512/get-browser-url-box-contents-with-javascript). Maybe , I had not ask clear , but try to edit this Quora queation, it pop "Rich-text editing requires the iOS or Android App. Download it from the App Store or Google Play Store." I had Andriod only , But in China, most Android phone have not Google Play Market, hard to do beacuse of GFW I mentioned. Had to write here.

In screenshot2, although your ISP is not giving you the content you request, it is still giving you content so a page is rendered and javascript is executed. In screenshot1, your ISP has blocked it and isn't giving you any content. Chrome therefore doesn't render a page and javascript is not executed. When I was writing my Chrome Extension, @Oh No You Didn't! I had a similar issue and exploited this "feature" to my benefit. What exactly are you trying to achieve? Maybe there is another way of doing it?
